content.description: Start as for Flying Cliff Babies for 3 bolts then follow the route to the right through hueco's with foot to hand matches to a few difficult two finger pockets, some crimps, long reaches and a couple of good rests.  Excellent climbing, with great movements.  The bolts are old school sport with approximately 10+ feet between bolts.  A bit heady if you are at your limit or use to routes more sewn up.
content.protection: Start by clipping the first three 3/8" bolts for Flying Cliff Babies, then move right onto Stainless 3/8" 5 piece bolts with Metolius Stainless hangers.  Bolts are spaced about 10-12 feet, making for a much more spicy route.  The route rejoins Flying Cliff Babies and finishes at a 2 bolt anchor with plated chain connected with a single cold shut for rappel.  Use nothing shorter than a 70 meter cord, or trail a second 60 meter for the rappel.
content.location: This route is located right of Flying Cliff Babies.

content.description: Look for the line of brownish camouflaged bolts leading up the left side of Devastation Pilllar. The route begins by scrambling up easy 5th class terrain past 2 bolts. Clip a 3rd bolt before heading up a V0+ move with a possible ledge fall to clip the 4th bolt. Move up, then left pulling a mono with good feet to help pull through to a jug for the 5th clip.  Follow fun pockets and crimps to the top and clip the chains. A 70 meter rope is a must have to lower off. Anything less will leave you stranded several meters up.
content.protection:
10 - 3/8" 5 piece stainless bolts with Blue Water Stainless hangers.

Anchor uses 2- 3/8" bolts and plated chain connected with a single cold shut for lower off or rappel.
content.location: This route can be accessed at the top for TR by scrambling through sand, burnt manzanitas and loose blocks. A 70 meter rope reaches the bottom with enough length to tie safety knots as a backup for a rappel or to lower off after a lead.
